title.rendered: UV Lights And Killing Covid-19: The Secret Behind The Science

content.rendered:
As the whole world fights the COVID-19 pandemic, a lot of scientists are shifting their attention to one tool that can help kill the coronavirus – ultraviolet lights.

UV lights installation can completely destroy up to 99.9% of pathogens. Initial tests have shown that UV lights can kill the virus responsible for the current pandemic as well.

How Does UV Lights Installation Kill COVID-19

Studies show that UV light can be used to kill the coronavirus present in the air and on surfaces. This is why many hospitals are now using UV lamps as an extra step in disinfecting their premises.

It’s important to note that while UV lights installation can clean your home’s indoor atmosphere, there is not enough proof to support that it can kill the COVID-19 infection in humans directly. This means you can use UV lights as a solid preventative measure – just don’t think it will kill the virus in someone who is already infected.

For decades, ultraviolet light has been used to stop pathogens from spreading. But can it also stop the SARS-CoV-2 that’s causing the pandemic?

Yes, it can – but only by using the right type of ultraviolet rays in the right dosage. This is why it’s recommended to contact a certified UV lights installer who can help you install the perfect UV lights necessary to kill the novel coronavirus.

It’s not a good idea to just buy any UV light device available in the market. You could end up wasting your money or worse, buy something that harms your health when you’re exposed to it.

Very few people know that UV radiation has 3 different types of wavelength – UVA, UVB, UVC.

Most of the UVB and UVC radiation emitted by the sun is absorbed by Earth’s ozone layer so the UV radiation that reaches us is mostly UVA. The most effective type of wavelength that works as a disinfectant is UVC.

UVC has been used by scientists and medical researchers to inactivate dangerous viruses like H1N1 influenza, Middle Eastern Respiratory Syndrome (MERS-CoV), and severe acute respiratory virus (SARS-CoV).

So when the COVID-19 pandemic hit, researchers tried to determine whether UVC will work in eliminating the SARS-CoV-2 (novel coronavirus) as well – which has now been confirmed.

Is UV Lights Installation Safe?

Just like overexposure to the sun can damage your skin, overexposure to UV lights can have the same effect. The key is to follow the safety measures associated with using a UV light inside your home. For example, you should only use UV lights to disinfect the space when nobody is there.

When you contact the UV lights installer, like United Home Services, we will make sure you know exactly how to use the UV lights in the safest way possible.

Fortify Your Home Against COVID-19 by Installing UV Lights

According to the CDC, UV lights are one of the most effective ways to clean your facemask and clothing that guard you against coronavirus. 

If you are worried about using UV lights or their impact on your health, know that these are FDA-approved and the majority of hospitals are already using them.
